data.name: ProcessName
data.comment: The name of our running process that the BHO uses for communication

data.name: SupportContactString
data.value: If the problem persists, click on your Protection Suite icon, select '?' then ‘Support’
data.comment: contact info for customer support for error messages

data.name: BHONotEnabledFmt
data.value:
You must enable {0} in Internet Explorer to add Other Accounts.
To do this, select 'Tools/Internet Options/Programs/Manage add-ons' and make sure {0} Protection Suite is set to enabled.
data.comment: Our BHO is not enabled. {0} = partner-specific short app display name

data.name: ThirdPartyExtensionsNotEnabled
data.value: Browser integration and protection is not enabled in Internet Explorer. Navigate to 'Tools/Internet Options/Advanced' and ensure that the option 'Enable third party browser extensions*' is checked.
data.comment: Third party extensions in IE not enabled.

data.name: SoftwareUpdate_Browser_IE
data.comment: Appears in software update to indicate that IE browser is running. Must have CRLF at end of it.

data.name: SoftwareUpdate_Browser_SecureViewFmt
data.comment: Appears in software update to indicate that Secure View browser is running. Must have CRLF at end of it.

data.name: SecurityUpdateBrowserRunningReadyFmt
data.value:
An important security update is ready to install.
During the update, {0} will be closed.
data.comment: This message appears when the software update is available and only one type of browser is running.

data.name: SecurityUpdateReady
data.value: An important security update is ready to install.
data.comment: This message appears when the software update is available and no browser is running.

data.name: SoftwareUpdateBrowsersRunningReadyFmt
data.comment: This message appears when the software update is available and more than one type of browser is running and the max postpone count has been reached. {0}=msg from DB, {2}=browsers open.

data.name: SoftwareUpdateDefaultMsgFmt
data.value: {0} has detected that a software update is available.
data.comment: Default message in case we can't retrieve the message from the database.

data.name: SoftwareUpdateNoBrowsersRunningAskToBeginNowFmt
data.value:
{0}
Are you ready to begin the {1} software update?
data.comment: This message appears when the software update is available and no browsers are running and the max postpone count hasn't been reached. It provides 2 options... Yes to start the update and Not Now to postpone it until later. {0}=msg from DB

data.name: SoftwareUpdateTitleFmt
data.comment: Title of the window that appears when software update is available.

data.name: SoftwareDownloadAlreadyInProgress
data.value: A software download is already in progress.
data.comment: Message displayed when the download has already been started.

data.name: S_SecurityUpdateSuccessful
data.comment: This message appears when the installer is complete and not in silent mode.

data.name: ErrorMsgOutOfMemoryFmt
data.comment: This message appears when an OutOfMemoryException occurs and the app is closed.

data.name: ErrorMsgUnexpectedErrorFmt
data.value:
An unexpected error occurred. {0} will restart automatically.
{1}
data.comment: This message appears when an unexpected exception occurs and the app is closed.

data.name: ErrorTitleFmt
data.comment: Title of error message box includes application name.

data.name: ErrorInsufficientMemoryToWriteToTokenFmt
data.value: The destination {0} is nearly full with account information, so the {1} cannot be completed. Please use another {0} to complete the {1}.
data.comment: This message is shown when trying to write to a token if there isn't enough room for the data to be written.

data.name: ErrorRestoreToBackupFmt
data.value: Restore cannot be performed to an {0} for Backup. Please insert a regular {0} now.
data.comment: This message is shown when tryng to do a backup to a non-backup token.

data.name: ErrorSameTokenFmt
data.value: You must {1} to a different {0}. Please use a different {0} to complete the {1}.
data.comment: This message is shown when trying to backup or restore to the same token.

data.name: ErrorTokenNotEmptyQueryFmt
data.value:
The {0} you are using for {1} already contains secure account information. If you continue, this information will be overwritten.
Are you sure you want to continue?
data.comment: This message appears when trying to backup or restore to a token with data already on it.

data.name: ErrorTokenNotInitializedFmt
data.value: This {0} must be activated prior to using it.
data.comment: This message is shown when an uninitialized token is inserted.

data.name: PrintBackupCompletedFmt
data.value: Your {0} Backup Report has been sent to the printer. Please keep this report in a safe place.
data.comment: This message appears when print backup completes successfully.

data.name: PrintBackupTokenEmptyFmt
data.value: Your {0} does not contain any account information to be backed up.
data.comment: This message is shown when no data is on a token when printing a backup.

data.name: PrintBackupWindowTitleFmt
data.comment: Title of windows for print backup messages

data.name: TokenCommandPrintBackup
data.comment: Name of singleton command when performing print operation.

data.name: ToastErrRegularTokenNotInitializedFmt
data.value: This {0} must be activated prior to using it.
data.comment: Message shown in the toast when an uninitialized token is inserted.

data.name: ErrCorruptDataStore
data.value: There is a problem with accessing the list of Trusted Network Secure Financial Institutions. This is being updated for you. Please try again in a few minutes.

data.name: ErrInitCryptokiInitializationFailedFmt
data.value:
The Smart Card library couldn't be initialized. {0} will now stop. To resolve this problem, please restart your PC.
{1}

data.name: ErrInitRegisterBrowserHooksFmt
ErrInitRegisterFileExtention
ErrInitSmartcardServiceFailedFmt
data.value:
The Windows Smart Card service could not be started. This service is required to access {0}. {0} will now stop.
{1}

data.name: ErrInitTokenReturnedWrongTypeFmt
data.value: {0} cannot be initialized. Please remove {0} and insert it again.

data.name: NotifyTipAccessingTokenFmt
data.comment: Tool tip that appears over icon in system tray when accessing the inserted token.

data.name: NotifyTipActivatingTokenFmt
data.comment: Tool tip that appears over icon in system tray when the inserted token is being activated.

data.name: NotifyTipLockedRegularTokenFmt
data.comment: Tool tip that appears over icon in system tray when regular token is locked.

data.name: NotifyTipUnlockedRegularTokenFmt
data.comment: Tool tip that appears over icon in system tray when regular token is not locked.

data.name: ToastMsgReadingInitializedTokenFmt
data.comment: Message shown in the toast when initialized token is inserted.

data.name: ToastMsgRegularTokenReadyFmt
data.comment: Message shown in the toast when a regular token is ready to be used.

data.name: TokenCommandActivationFmt
data.comment: Name of singleton command when activation wizard appears for uninitialized token. This text is shown in the situation where the token is removed or another command is tried.

data.name: S_ClickToRenewSubscription
data.value: Click here to renew your subscription
data.comment: Used for the link that users will click on to subscribe to the TN

data.name: S_SubscriptionRequired
data.comment: Used when an action requires subscription to the TN. We show a toast for this.

data.name: ErrActivateBackupTokenGeneralFmt
data.value: An error occurred trying to initialize the {0} for Backup. Please insert {0} and try backing up again.
data.comment: This error message appears when an error occurs trying to activate the uninitialized backup token.

data.name: ErrActivateBackupTokenWriteFailedFmt
data.value: An error occurred trying to write data to the {0} for Backup. Please reinsert your {0} and try backing it up again.
data.comment: This error message appears when an error occurs trying to write to the backup token doing the activation of the uninitialized backup token.

data.name: S_ErrorProcessingRenewalTitle
data.comment: Title of the message shown when a problem occurs processing the token currency to renew the subscription.

data.name: S_SubscriptionExtendedMsgFmt
data.value:
Congratulations! Your Subscription to the {0} Service has been updated successfully.
Your subscription is now active through {1}. A confirmation email has been sent to the email address you provided.
data.comment: This message appears in a message box when the subscription renewal has been applied successfully.

data.name: S_SubscriptionExtendedTitleFmt
data.comment: This is the title of the message box that appears when the subscription renewal has been applied successfully.

data.name: S_WriteSubscriptionMsgTitle
data.comment: Shown when we're opening a browser to display a product message

data.name: S_SubscriptionHasAlreadyBeenUpdatedTitle
data.value: Your subscription has already been updated
data.comment: Title for a window shown, when the user is trying to reapply the same token currency

data.name: S_SubscriptionUpdateUserCancel
data.value: We were not able to update your ID Vault Service Subscription. Please make sure your ID Vault is inserted in your USB port. If you don’t have your ID Vault, refer to the directions in your confirmation email on how to update your ID Vault Service Subscription later.
data.comment: If the user cancels the token update after paying for a subscription.

data.name: ErrInitTokenNotPersonalized
data.value:
Your {0} is failing. Trying removing and then reinserting {0} from your computer to resolve this problem.
{1}
data.comment: Token is not personalized; either from manufacturing or lost personalization

data.name: S_RenewSubscription_ErrMsgRetrieving
data.value: An error occured trying to contact the server to retrieve subscription renewal information.

data.name: S_WCFServiceCommunicationError
data.value:
{0} cannot connect to the internet. Internet access is required for security reasons.
Check your internet connection and try again.
data.comment: Message shown when there is a communication error thrown by a web service (WCF one) such as the user trying to use the software token being offline.

data.name: S_DotNetRemotingErrorMsgFmt
data.value:
Your {0} has encountered a problem related to a known issue with the Microsoft .NET software.
For detailed instructions on how to resolve this issue, click on the {0} icon, select ‘Support’, click on ‘Find Answers’ and search on ‘IPC Error’.”
data.comment: Shown when the user experiences a .NET Remoting IPC channel failure.

data.name: SoftwareUpdateFileDownloaded
data.comment: This message appears when a software update file has been downloaded and needs to be installed on a Vista system when the UAC prompt will appear.

data.name: ErrInitTokenFileNotPresent
data.value:
The secure password file that was created when you set up Protection Suite cannot be found or it is corrupted.
You will need to repeat the Protection Suite set up process to recreate this file.
data.comment: Token file is deleted from machine

data.name: SoftwareUpdateDownloading
data.comment: Downloading update.

data.name: SoftwareUpdateFailedFmt
data.value: {0} can not be updated at this time. Please try again later.
data.comment: Update failed message. {0} = application display name.

data.name: SoftwareUpdateNetworkUnavailableFmt
data.value: {0} can not check for updates at this time because your internet connection is not available.
data.comment: Network unavailable message. {0} = application display name.

data.name: S_SoftwareUpdateUnavailable
data.comment: No update available message. {0} = application display name.

data.name: CertCorruptErrorFmt
data.value:
The security certificate that was created when you installed {0} cannot be opened. It may have been damaged or deleted by another application.
To protect your security, you will now need to re-create your Master PIN and add your accounts again. We apologize for any inconvenience.
data.comment: {0} = application display name.

data.name: S_TimeDiffTooLarge
data.value:
Your computer's clock is not set correctly. Accurate time is required by {0} for secure communication.
Please set your computer's clock to the correct time.

data.name: S_IncorrectPIN
data.value: An incorrect Master PIN was entered. For security reasons you only have four chances to enter the correct PIN.
data.comment: Shown when the user enters in incorrect PIN.

data.name: S_LastIncorrectPIN
data.value:
An incorrect Master PIN was entered. The next attempt is the FINAL opportunity you have to enter the correct PIN.
If you enter an incorrect PIN again, your secure password file will be deleted and you will need to add your accounts again.

data.name: S_PINLocked
data.value:
An incorrect Master PIN for your {0} was entered four times. For security reasons your {0} secure password file has been erased.
You will now be prompted to recreate your PIN. You will then need to add your accounts to {0} again.

data.name: S_AccessingTokenError
data.value: An unexpected error occurred while accessing {0}.{1}{1}Please click Ok to abort the Wizard.

data.name: S_AddSiteSubscriptionRequiredTooltipFmt
data.value: Your {0} Trusted Network Subscription has expired. Renew now to extend your subscription.
data.comment: Show this tooltip when the user clicks on the Add Financial or Add Shopping site buttons in the Add/Remove site wizard.

data.name: S_AllTNSitesListboxHeaderTextFmt
data.comment: Displays in the Add Account Wizard listbox

data.name: S_CertNotFound
data.value: Your {0} cannot locate the security certificate that was created when you initially installed the {0} software. Please contact {0} Support to report this issue. To contact support click on the {0} icon, select 'Support' then 'Customer Support'.

data.name: S_CorruptDataStoreError
data.value: There is a problem with accessing the list of Trusted Network Secure Financial Institutions. This is being updated for you. Please try again in a few minutes.

data.name: S_ErrorAddingFinancialAccount
data.value: A problem occurred trying to add a financial account. Log off or reboot your computer to resolve this issue. If the problem persists, click on the Protection Suite icon, select ‘Support’ then ‘Customer Support’

data.name: S_ErrorAddingOtherSiteAccount
data.value: A problem occurred trying to add an account. Log off or reboot your computer to resolve this issue.If the problem persists, click on the Protection Suite icon, select ‘Support’ then ‘Customer Support’

data.name: S_ErrorAddingShoppingAccount
data.value: A problem occurred trying to add a shopping account. Log off or reboot your computer to resolve this issue.If the problem persists, click on the Protection Suite icon, select ‘Support’ then ‘Customer Support’

data.name: S_ErrorConnectionNotAvailable
data.value: Your {0} cannot connect to the internet. You must have an active internet connection to use your {0}.

data.name: S_ErrorInitializingToken
data.value: General error occured while activating your {0}

data.name: S_ErrorPrintingSerialNumber
data.value: There was an error printing the serial number. Please check you have a working printer setup properly on your computer and try again.

data.name: S_ErrPinCodeNotValid
data.value: The PIN must be at least 4 digits long and repeated numbers (ex. 1111) or sequential numbers (ex. 1234) are not allowed
data.comment: Displayed when PIN code is too short or not valid.

data.name: S_ErrPinCodesNotMatching
data.comment: Displayed when entering PIN when Enter PIN doesn't match Re-type PIN.

data.name: S_ErrRestoreMustBeFromBackupTokenFmt
data.value: To restore information to your new {0} you must insert an {0} for Backup.
data.comment: This message toast appears when trying to restore from a regular, non-backup token.

data.name: S_MenuTextBackupTokenNotInitializedFmt
data.value: To backup to this {0} for Backup, insert an {0} and run Backup from the Control Center.
data.comment: Message shown in the menu when an uninitialized backup token is inserted (not during a backup since that initializes the token automatically).

data.name: S_ModifyAccountCredentials
data.comment: Title text for message box in Add Account Wizard when user is asked if they want to try different credentials

data.name: S_OperationBackup
data.comment: This is the displayed name of the Backup operation. Due to the similarities in backup and restore, the text is simply substituted when displaying certain information to the user.

data.name: S_OperationNotAllowedWithExpiredTokenFmt
data.value: The {0} Subscription is expired or not activated

data.name: S_OperationRestore
data.comment: This is the displayed name of the Restore operation. Due to the similarities in backup and restore, the text is simply substituted when displaying certain information to the user.

data.name: S_ProductOfferWaitToast
data.value: Contacting server to retrieve product information...

data.name: S_RenewSubscriptionFavoriteInfoTitle
data.value: ID Vault Trusted Network Subscription Renewal
data.comment: This is the name of the web page being browsed to that is displayed on the "Opening site" window.

data.name: S_RenewSubscriptionWaitToast
data.value: Contacting server to retrieve subscription information...
data.comment: This toast is displayed when the user clicks on the Renew Subscription ghyperlink in the Info tab of Control Center.

data.name: S_RenewSubscription_ErrMsgLaunching
data.value: An error occured trying to start the Secure View Browser to start your subscription renewal.

data.name: S_SerialNumberPrintingDone
data.value: The serial number was successfully sent to your printer. Please pick it up now and keep it in a safe place in case you lose or forget the PIN code.

data.name: S_ShowLastTransactionMsgIdFmt
data.value:
The last unexpected error resulted in the unique code below.
If you haven't done so yet, please restart {0} by logging off of Windows and then back into Windows.
data.comment: This message appears when a user asks to see the last unexpected error.

data.name: S_SubscriptionExpirationFmt
data.comment: Shows the unexpired subscription expiration date in the Info tab of Control Center.

data.name: S_SubscriptionExpiredFmt
data.comment: Shows the expired subscription expiration date in the Info tab of Control Center.

data.name: S_SubscriptionRequiredToast
data.comment: To

data.name: S_TryDifferentCredentialsQuestion
data.value: Would you like to try a different user name or password for this account?
data.comment: Question asked to the user when they say that signon failed in the Add Account Wizard

data.name: S_UnableToLaunchBrowser
data.value: Unable to launch browser for web page {0}

data.name: S_WaitWhileSecureViewOpensForProductMessage
data.value: Please wait while Secure View opens...

data.name: S_ConfirmCancel
data.value: Are you sure you want to cancel?
data.comment: Cancel confirmation question for dialogs.

data.name: S_ConfirmCancelCaption
data.comment: Header used in cancel confirmation dialogs.

data.name: S_ConfirmCancelSecurityScan
data.value: Are you sure you want to cancel the account scan?
data.comment: Shown in cancel confirmation dialogs in the Credentials Scan process.

data.name: S_ManualSignOnMissingInfo
data.value: Sign in as you normally would so ID Vault can save additional information about this Web site.
data.comment: Shown in the manual sign-on toast when an Other account is open that has no XPath data.

data.name: S_ManualSignOnTN
data.value: Complete this Web page to continue logging in.
data.comment: Shown in the manual sign-on toast when automated sign-in fails.

data.name: S_AccountAdded
data.comment: Shown in a toast to confirm that an account is added

data.name: S_AccountUpdated
data.comment: Shown in a toast to confirm that an account has been updated

data.name: S_TokenNotSignedInErrorFmt
data.value: Your secure password file cannot be accessed. Please restart {0} and try again.
data.comment: Error shown to the user when the token is unexpectedly accessed when not signed in. {0} = Application display name.

data.name: S_DatabaseEntryForRequestedSiteNotFound
data.value: Your Protection Suite was unable to find the requested site in the database. Please contact customer Support about this problem.
data.comment: If for some reason, the user wants to add a site (from the search page) and the site is not in the local data base (should never happen in theory), we want to show an error.

data.name: S_FinishOpenBeforeDashboard
data.value: Please finish adding or opening the account before accessing your Protection Suite.
data.comment: Shown in a toast when the user tries to open Control Center when an account is already being opened.

data.name: S_TooManyAccountsFmt
data.value: You already have four accounts for {0}, which is the maximum number that your {1} can store for one Web site.
data.comment: {0} = account name. {1} = application display name.

data.name: ServiceUnavailable
data.comment: This message appears when the Pin Service timeout

data.name: S_InvalidIPErrorFmt
data.value:
Your {0} has detected that you are NOT connected to a legitimate IP address that your {0} has verified for '{1}.' For your protection, your {0} will not sign you in to this unexpected IP address.
We constantly monitor and verify IP addresses; if an update is necessary, it will be available shortly.
data.comment: Invalid signon URI error message. {0} = application display name. {1} = account name.

data.name: S_AccountDamagedFmt
data.value:
This account cannot be opened because the account information is damaged.
You can delete and re-create the account in the {0} dashboard.
data.comment: {0} = application display name

data.name: S_CantNavigateOutOfDomain
data.value: Leaving this web site is not allowed for security reasons.
data.comment: This is shown when the user tries to navigate out of a bank's site domain. We do not allow that.

data.name: S_CantNavigateOutOfDomainCaption
data.comment: This is shown when the user tries to navigate out of a bank's site domain. We do not allow that.

data.name: S_CompleteThisPage
data.value: Complete this page if you are not already logged in

data.name: S_NonHTTPSPostSecurityWarning
data.value: This site is attempting to transmit your credentials in an insecure manner. Are you sure you want to continue to this site?
data.comment: Message shown as a security warning when a financial site attempts to post to a non-HTTPS URL

data.name: S_NonHTTPSPostSecurityWarningCaption
data.comment: Message shown as a security warning when a financial site attempts to post to a non-HTTPS URL

data.name: S_SaveAccount
data.value:
Click "Yes" if you logged in correctly.
Click "No" to go back and retry.

data.name: S_SignInToAddAccount
data.value: Log in to this account to set up one-click access

data.name: S_SignInToUpdateAccountFmt
data.value: Log in to this Web site to update it in your {0}
data.comment: {0} = application display name

data.name: S_SiteChangedFmt
data.value:
This Web site cannot be {0} at this time because the site may have changed.
{1} is working to fix this site in a future update. Make sure you have the latest updates by clicking the ? Icon in the {1} and selecting 'Check for Updates'.
data.comment: Shown when a site cannot be opened or added. {0} = "added" or "opened". {1} = application display name.

data.name: S_OpenSiteTimeout
data.value:
This Web site is not loading completely so it cannot be added at this time.
You can still browse the site and it may appear normally in the browser.

data.name: S_InvalidEmail
data.comment: Shown in email validation message in activation dialog

data.name: S_UnexpectedTokenErrorFmt
data.value:
An unexpected error occured while accessing your {0}. Please try again.
{1}
data.comment: Shown when an unexpected exception occurs when signing in. {0} = App name. {1} = Support Contact String.

data.name: TrayBalloonCaptionFmt
data.comment: Shown in the tray icon balloon help that teaches the user about the tray icon. {0} = app name.

data.name: TrayBalloonMessageFmt
data.value: Click here to use your {0} for safer login to all of your accounts.
data.comment: Shown in the tray icon balloon help that teaches the user about the tray icon. {0} = app name.

data.name: S_PhishingWarningMessage
data.value:
{0} does not recognize the IP address used to reach {1}.
Are you sure you want to proceed?
data.comment: Phishing warning dialog message

data.name: S_ErrorRenamingAccountsWhileTheyAreBeingModified
data.value: The account could not be renamed because the list of accounts was being modified outside of the dashboard.

data.name: S_ConfirmOtherAccountLogin
data.value:
Click "Yes" if you logged in correctly.
Click "No" to log in again.

data.name: S_ConfirmTNAccountLogin
data.value:
Click "Yes" if you logged in correctly.
Click "No" to go back and retry.

data.name: S_USBFlashDeviceUnplugged
data.value: The USB device where ID Vault was running from has been removed.

data.name: BackupFailed
data.value: An error occured backing up your online accounts.

data.name: BackupSuccess
data.value: Backup created successfully. The file has been protected using your current Master PIN.

data.name: RestoreEnterPIN
data.value: Enter the Master PIN that was used to protect this backup file

data.name: RestoreError
data.value: An error occured restoring the backup.

data.name: RestoreIncorrectPIN
data.value: The PIN you entered does not match with PIN that was used to create this backup. Please try again.

data.name: RestoreSameAccountLimitFmt
data.value: Backup restored successfully, however, restoring '{0}' would exceed the maximum account limit. {1} can store only four accounts for a given website.
data.comment: {0} = site name. {1} = application display name.

data.name: SoftwareUpdate_Browser_IEandFF
data.comment: Appears in software update to indicate that IE/FF browser is running. Must have CRLF at end of it.

data.name: S_CantStartDesktopIDVaultWhenAPortableIsRunning
data.value:
Your Protection Suite cannot start until the portable ID Vault is shutdown. Click on the ID Vault Portable system tray icon and select the shutdown option.
If you continue to have problems, click your Protection Suite desktop icon to start it again.

data.name: S_EnforcePortableIDVSingleton
data.value: The Portable ID Vault cannot run now. Only one Portable ID Vault may be used at a time.

data.name: S_EnforcePortableIDVSingletonTitle
data.value: New Portable ID Vault Plugged In

data.name: S_CantRestartDesktopIDV
data.value: Your Protection Suite was unable to start. Please click on the ID Proteciton Suite desktop icon to start the program manually.

data.name: S_CantRestartDesktopIDVTitle
data.value: Your Protection Suite Could Not Start

data.name: S_PortableIDVNotSupportedWithPre56DesktopIDV
data.value:
Portable ID Vault is only supported with a Desktop ID Vault version 5.6 or later. Please update your Desktop ID Vault to the most recent version before using the Portable ID Vault.
To update the Desktop ID Vault, click on the ID Vault system tray icon->Support->Check For Updates Now

data.name: SoftwareUpdateNeedAdminPrivFmt
data.value: {0} needs adminstrator privileges to execute software update.

data.name: S_Loading
data.comment: Shown in the tray icon balloon help when portable version is loading

data.name: S_IDVServiceNotRunningErr
data.value: Your Protection Suite Windows service is not currently running. This service is required for the suite work properly and monitor its processes. Your Protection Suite will now restart to attempt to initiate the service.

data.name: S_IDVServiceNotRunningErr2
data.value: Your Protection Suite Windows service is not currently running. This service is required for the suite work properly and monitor its processes.Your Protection Suite was unable to start the service successfully. Please go to Control Panel->Administrative Tools->Services and start "ID Vault Service".

data.name: S_IDVServiceNotRunningErrTitle
data.value: ID Vault Service Is Not Running

data.name: S_UninstallCertificateFmt
data.value:
If you plan to reinstall your {0}, click Save so you won’t have to enter your account information again.
To permanently delete all {0} files, including your personal account information, click Delete.

data.name: S_MultipleUsersLoggedFmt
data.value:
Your {0} is already running for another user logged onto this computer.
To run your {0} as user "{1}", first log off all users. Then log on again as user "{1}".

data.name: S_GuestUserWarningFmt
data.value: Guest users have no permission to run {0}

data.name: S_FailedToStartWithMediumIntegrityFmt
data.value:
A problem occurred trying to launch your {0}. Try to reboot your computer to correct this issue
{1}

data.name: S_NoInternetConnectionTrayMessageFmt
data.value: Your {0} cannot connect to the internet

data.name: S_ExpiredSubscriptionTooltipFmt
data.value: Your {0} subscription has expired. Renew by selecting ‘Support’ and ‘Renew Now’.
data.comment: {0} == Application display name

data.name: S_FinishEditBeforeDashboard
data.value: You must finish editing your account or close the web page before accessing your Protection Suite.

data.name: S_BrowserExtensionRestartOnly
data.value: Your {0} needs to close your web browser to fully protect your online accounts.

data.name: S_BrowserExtensionInstallAndRestartBrowser
data.value: Your browser needs to be updated with the latest protection. During the update process, all open browsers will be automatically closed.

data.name: S_BrowserExtensionInstallOnly
data.value: Your {0} needs to install browser extensions so you can add accounts using your browser.

data.name: S_OutOfDomainNavigationWarning
data.value:
You are about to leave this Web site and open a new Web page that is not recognized by your Protection Suite.
If you are sure this is a safe site, click "Continue".

data.name: S_DoNotUnplugUSBWhileUpdating
data.value: Do not unplug ID Vault while update is in process.

data.name: CannotAddOtherAccounts
data.value: Your Protection Suite cannot add 'Other' accounts on this computer.

data.name: S_InstallCompleteRestartFmt
data.value: Restart your browser and log in to your online accounts as you normally do and {0} will prompt you to set up secure one-click access.
data.comment: Shown at the end of install if browser needs restarting.

data.name: S_InstallCompleteVirtualizedFmt
data.value: Start protecting your accounts now by choosing an option from the {0} menu.
data.comment: Shown at the end of install if portable is running virtualized.

data.name: S_IDVaultServiceNotRunning
data.value: Your Protection Suite Windows service is not currently running. This service is required for the suite work properly and monitor its processes. Protection Suite will now stop.

data.name: S_UpdateNeedReoot
data.value: {0} Security Update successful. Keylogger protection will be enabled after you next reboot.

data.name: S_PINMouseEntryToolTip
data.value: Click the numbers with your mouse to create your Master PIN

data.name: S_InstallRestartMessage
data.value:
You must restart your computer to complete the installation of important security features. We recommend that you restart your computer immediately.
Restart now?
data.comment: Shown by the dashboard when a restart is pending

data.name: S_SecurityAndKeyLoggerUpdateSuccessful
data.value: You must restart your computer to complete the security update.

data.name: S_ServerError
data.value: Error occured contacting server please retry again.

data.name: S_IE9WarningFmt
data.value: Internet Explorer requires permission to enable {0} Protection. Click “OK” so you can securely login to all your online accounts with just one click.
data.comment: {0} = partner-specific short app display name

data.name: S_IE9WarningTitleFmt
data.comment: {0} = partner-specific short app display name

data.name: S_BackEndServicesNotReacheable
data.value: An Internet connectivity issue has been detected. Check your personal firewall settings to ensure the {0} has access to the Internet. If you continue to experience this issue, please visit our FAQs from the link below.
data.comment: Shown if there is a connectivity issue before we call the sky. {0} == app name

data.name: S_SoftwareUpdateBrowserOpenWarning
data.value: In order to update the {0}, we need to close your open browsers. Do you want to do that now?
data.comment: This message appears when the software update is available and more than one type of browser is running

data.name: S_SoftwareUpdateWillTakePlaceAtNextReboot
data.value: The {0} will be updated the next time you reboot your computer.
data.comment: if the users chooses not to update now, we will tell them we'll do this at the next reboot

data.name: S_KeepAntiKeyLoggingDisabledFmt
data.value: Anti-keylogging functionality is about to be re-enable. Would you like continue to have anti-keylogging disabled for another {0} minutes?
data.comment: Shown in an IPC call from service when service's timer expired. {0} = number of minutes.

data.name: S_RebootRequired
data.value: Please SAVE all your data before continuing update. An automatic reboot may be performed after completion of the manual software update. Start update?

data.name: S_BrowserExtensionInstallCloseBrowser
data.value: Your {0} needs to close your web browser to install a browser extension.

data.name: DnssecPromptToTurnOnFeature
data.value:
The Constant Guard Protection Suite now has a safety feature to let you know if your are not using Constant Guard Secure DNS servers. You are NOT currently connected to Constant Guard Secure DNS servers. We recommend that you use Constant Guard Secure DNS servers to help avoid fraudulent and malicious web sites.
Connect to the Constant Guard DNS servers when you use the Xfinity Internet service?

data.name: S_UpdateManualCheck
data.comment: Shown as a toast when the user manually checks for updates

data.name: RestoreIncorrectPINNumberOfTriesExceeded
data.value: The PIN you entered does not match with PIN that was used to create this backup. Maximum number of attempts reached. The Restore functionality has been temporarily disabled.

data.name: DnssecSettingsChangedAlertText
data.value: The Constant Guard Protection Suite detected a change in your DNS settings and will automatically switch back to Constant Guard Secure DNS. If you wish to use another DNS, please turn the DNS lock setting to OFF in the Options tab.

data.name: DnssecTurnOffAreYouSure
data.value:
The Constant Guard DNS servers use DNSSEC to help protect you from phishing and other cyber threats. If you turn off DNS Lock, your computer can connect to other DNS servers which may not have this protection.
Are you sure you want to make this change?

data.name: DnssecTurnOnConfirmationText
data.value: The Constant Guard Protection Suite has updated your DNS settings to use Constant Guard Secure DNS. As a security protection, if your DNS settings change to a different DNS while using the Xfinity Internet service, the Constant Guard Protection Suite will automatically switch back to Constant Guard Secure DNS.

data.name: SF_MasterPINActivation
data.value: Your Master PIN allows you to securely access your {0}
data.comment: shown when activating and creating teh PIN. {0} is the full product name.

data.name: S_FirefoxWarningFmt1
data.value: Firefox requires permission to enable {0} Protection. Click “OK” so you can securely login to all your online accounts with just one click.
data.comment: {0} = partner-specific short app display name

data.name: S_AccountAlreadyEstablished
data.value: We're sorry! You are not logged in as the correct windows user of AOL OnePoint. Please sign off and log in as a different windows user.

data.name: ActivationWizardHelperNoteText
data.value: Use your mouse to click 4-8 numbers

data.name: ActivationWizardRetypePinHelperNoteText
data.value: Please click your 4-8 number PIN again

data.name: S_ErrorOpeningIDGSite
data.value: Unable to open the Identity Guard web page. Please try again.

data.name: S_AudioAccessAttemptDetected
data.value: The program {0} is trying to connect to your microphone in order make an audio call. Do not click 'Allow' unless this is a legitimate application, such as Instant Messenger or a similar trusted application.

data.name: S_BrowserAccessAttemptDetected
data.value: The program {0} is trying to install a suspicious BHO.\nBHOs are common plugins written for 'Internet Explorer' to enhance its capabilities. However, this feature can also be misused by spyware programs to capture a user’s login credentials. Do not click 'Allow' unless this is a trusted and known application.

data.name: S_ClipboardAccessAttemptDetected
data.value: The program {0} is attempting to capture images of data on your clipboard. Do not click 'Allow' unless this is a trusted and known application.

data.name: S_DriverLoadAttemptDetected
data.value: The program {0} is trying to modify critical system data. Do not click 'Allow' unless this is a trusted and known application.

data.name: S_KeyLoggingAttemptDetected
data.value: The program {0} is trying to log your keystrokes. Do not click 'Allow' unless this is a trusted and known application.

data.name: S_ScreenCaptureAttemptDetected
data.value: The program {0} is trying to capture an image of your current monitor’s screen. Do not click 'Allow' unless this is a trusted and know application.

data.name: S_UnknownDriverActivityDetected
data.value: An unknown program is taking an unrecognized action. It is strongly recommended that you do not click 'Allow' unless know this is trusted application.

data.name: S_WebcamAccessAttemptDetected
data.value: The program {0} is trying to connect to your webcam. Do not click 'Allow' unless this is a legitimate application such as an Instant Messenger or a similar trusted application.

data.name: AccountWizardEnterCredentialsText
data.value: Enter your username/password and then click the "Set Up" button to set up an encrypted secure login.

data.name: AccountWizardSubHeaderText
data.value: This wizard helps you set up popular accounts so you can login securely with a single click. Just enter your username and password and we will encrypt them on your computer so only you have access to them.

data.name: AccountWizardConfLeftRememberText

data.name: ActiveXWarningFriendlyMessage
data.value: One or more ActiveX controls on the page have been blocked for your security. As a result, some content may not be displayed.
data.comment: The user-friendly message displayed from SecureView when it blocks ActiveX control or other plugins.

data.name: ActiveXWarningOriginalMessage
data.value:
One or more ActiveX controls could not be displayed because either:

1) Your current security settings prohibit running ActiveX controls on this page, or
2) You have blocked a publisher of one of the controls.

As a result, the page might not display correctly.
data.comment: The original message displayed from SecureView when it blocks ActiveX control or other plugins.

data.name: SiteWasRemovedFromTNErrorMessageFormat
data.value:
We're sorry, but the account you are trying to access no longer exists in the Trusted Network. The site may have merged with another institution, or gone out of business.
If this is still a valid account you would like saved to your {0}, please delete the account, and re-add it your vault by logging into the account manually using your default internet browser.
data.comment: Error message shown when user tries to open an account that its site info has been removed from TN
